(1992) | Misc = }} "'''What Can You Do For Me'''" is the debut single by [[United Kingdom|British]] [[dance music|dance]] group [[Utah Saints]]. The song was released in August 1991 and reached a peak position of number 10 in the [[UK Singles Chart]]. The song uses samples from "[[There Must Be an Angel (Playing with My Heart)]]" by [[Eurythmics]] and "[[Ain't Nothin' Goin' on But the Rent]]" by [[Gwen Guthrie]]. ==Chart performance== The single was released in August 1991 and entered the UK Singles Chart on 18 August at number 28. The song steadily rose up the chart and peaked at number 10 on 15 September. The song spent a total of 11 weeks inside the top 75 chart. {|class="wikitable" !Chart (1991) !Peak
